title: 2024 World AeroPress Champion - George Stanica (Romania) - Inverted
preparation_steps: Rinse one Aesir paper filter with hot water and fit it in the cap (removes papery taste).
Assemble the AeroPress in inverted position and align it approx. to the 4th mark.
Weigh 18 g of coffee and grind to medium-coarse (Comandante C40 Mk4, ~58 clicks / ~870 µm).
Add the 18 g ground coffee to the inverted AeroPress and give a gentle shake to level the bed.
Prepare extraction water (96 °C) and a Melodrip (or similar) for controlled pours. Have scale and timer ready.

brewing_steps.instruction: Start timer and pour 50 g of 96 °C water using the Melodrip (aim 5–6 s for the pour). Allow the coffee to bloom: wait ~30 s (bloom period ends ~00:35).
brewing_steps.audio_script: In 35 seconds, you should have finished the bloom. Start your timer and pour 50 grams of 96 degrees Celsius water using the Melodrip. Aim for about 5 to 6 seconds for the pour. Allow the coffee to bloom and wait about 30 seconds - the bloom period ends at 35 seconds.

brewing_steps.instruction: Pour the second 50 g of 96 °C water (again ~5–6 s pour).
brewing_steps.audio_script: In 6 seconds, you should have poured the second water. Now pour the second 50 grams of 96 degrees Celsius water. Again, aim for about 5 to 6 seconds for this pour to maintain consistency.

brewing_steps.instruction: Stir gently in a North–South–East–West (NSEW) pattern for ~10 s to homogenize.
brewing_steps.audio_script: In 10 seconds, you should have finished stirring. Now stir gently in a North-South-East-West pattern for about 10 seconds to homogenize the coffee slurry. This ensures even extraction and proper mixing of the grounds.

brewing_steps.instruction: At 1:05 (≈65 s) screw on the rinsed cap and gently press to remove excess air (~10 s).
brewing_steps.short_instruction: Screw on cap • Press out air
brewing_steps.audio_script: In 14 seconds, you should have the cap on and air pressed out. At 1:05, screw on the rinsed cap and gently press to remove excess air. This should take about 10 seconds and helps create a proper seal.

brewing_steps.instruction: Give a gentle swirl to the AeroPress, place it onto your serving vessel, and begin the slow, controlled press. Aim to finish pressing within 30–40 s. Target yield: ~76–79 g of concentrate.
brewing_steps.short_instruction: Swirl gently • Place on vessel • Press 30-40s
brewing_steps.audio_script: You have 40 seconds to complete this step. Give a gentle swirl to the AeroPress, place it onto your serving vessel, and begin the slow, controlled press. Aim to finish pressing within 30 to 40 seconds. Your target yield should be about 76 to 79 grams of concentrate.

brewing_steps.instruction: When press is complete, add warm water until total weight reaches 130–135 g (bypass step).
brewing_steps.audio_script: In 20 seconds, you should have added the warm water. When the press is complete, add warm water until the total weight reaches 130 to 135 grams. This is the bypass step that dilutes the concentrate to your desired strength.

brewing_steps.instruction: Add an additional 20–30 g of room-temperature 0 ppm water for balance (final total ≈150–165 g depending on target).
brewing_steps.audio_script: In 5 seconds, you should have finished adding water. Add an additional 20 to 30 grams of room-temperature 0 parts per million water for balance. The final total should be about 150 to 165 grams depending on your target strength.

equipment: Comandante C40 Mk4 (or equivalent) for grind reference
notes: Recipe by George Stanica (World Champ 2024). Focus on precise water chemistry and two pours for controlled saturation. Bypass at two temperatures (hot water for strength and 0 ppm water at room temperature for balance and clarity). The medium-coarse grind and slow pressing seek clarity while avoiding over-extraction.
